channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pope Finds Fervent Fans Among Indonesia’s Transgender Community
item.description: For many trans women living on the fringes of the nation’s society, the Catholic Church is a haven, and Pope Francis a personal hero.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Polio Campaign Enters Next Phase in Gaza as Israeli Airstrikes Continue
item.description: As the first phase of vaccinations ended, an Israeli strike hit a hospital courtyard in central Gaza where people were sheltering, Palestinian news me...

item.title: Albertsons and Kroger CEOs tell skeptical government that grocery mega merger won’t lead to store closures and higher prices
item.description: The two CEOs said merging would allow the supermarket companies to lower prices and more effectively compete with retail giants like Walmart, Costco a...

item.title: The Coming Election Battles
item.description: Polls suggest the presidential contest will be close. Both sides expect a fight over the outcome.

item.title: In the Paralympic Fix-It Shop, Plenty of Fractures but No Blood
item.description: Repair technicians at the Paris Games fix everything from bent wheelchair frames to broken sunglasses.

item.title: Deloitte-run Medicaid systems are riddled with glitches that can cost millions and take years to fix
item.description: Medicaid beneficiaries risk losing access to health care and food due to error-prone state eligibility systems.

item.title: A School Shooting in Georgia, and 2 High-Profile Cases Return to Court
item.description: Plus, bogus bands, fake fans and $10 million.

item.title: Pope Finds Fervent Fans Among Indonesia’s Transgender Community
item.description: For many trans women living on the fringes of the nation’s society, the Catholic Church is a haven, and Pope Francis a personal hero.

item.title: Elon Musk’s misery is limited to Brazil for now, but EU sanctions may be coming his way
item.description: Potential fines could be as high as six percent of X's annual worldwide turnover unless the company makes changes in line with EU demands.

item.title: Ugandan Olympic Runner Rebecca Cheptegei Dies After Gasoline Attack
item.description: The athlete, who was set on fire in Kenya by a man with whom she was in a relationship, competed in the women’s marathon at the Paris Olympics this su...

item.title: Ugandan Olympic Runner Rebecca Cheptegei Dies After Gasoline Attack
item.description: The athlete, who was set on fire in Kenya by a man with whom she was in a relationship, competed in the women’s marathon at the Paris Olympics this su...

item.title: New wave of Chinese migrants are flocking to Mexico
item.description: The arrival of Chinese multinationals is leading an influx of “people from eastern China, more educated and with a broader global background.”

item.title: Boredom Almost Killed the N.F.L. Kickoff. New Rules May Save It.
item.description: The league is trying to balance bringing some excitement back while keeping an eye on safety.

item.title: Racing the Clock to Document ISIS Genocide of Iraq’s Yazidis
item.description: For years, a U.N. team has painstakingly exhumed mass graves, but now the Iraqi government is ordering it to leave. Many sites remain unexamined.

item.title: Germany’s DAX 40 has a new female CEO: Daimler Truck appoints Karin Radstrom as next head in rare move
item.description: Radstrom will become just the second female CEO of a DAX 40 firm, joining Belen Garijo, the head of pharmaceutical giant Merck KGaA.
